data.chText: 衣衫褴褛的；破衣烂衫的
（轮廓线、边缘或表面）粗糙的，参差不齐的，不规则的
data.enText: having an outline, an edge or a surface that is not straight or even

data.chText: 我能够听到他那急促的呼吸声。
data.enText: I could hear the sound of his ragged breathing.

data.chText: 他们的表演仍然很粗糙。
data.enText: Their performance was still very ragged.
very tired, especially after physical effort
to make sb do a lot of work or make a big effort so that they become tired

word_means: 粗糙的，参差不齐的，不规则的

means: (轮廓线、边缘或表面)粗糙的，参差不齐的，不规则的

data.enText: to make sb do a lot of work or make a big effort so that they become tired

example: text set with ragged right margins
herded the class into a ragged line

tr: worn out from stress or strain
being or dressed in clothes that are worn or torn
example: clothes as ragged as a scarecrow's

value.def: Someone who is ragged looks untidy and is wearing clothes that are old and torn.

example.ex: The five survivors eventually reached safety, ragged, half-starved and exhausted.
example.tran: 5位幸存者最终到达安全之地时已经衣衫褴褛、饥肠辘辘、精疲力尽。

value.def: You can say that something is ragged when it is untidy or uneven.

example.ex: She could hear his ragged breathing, as if he had been running...
example.tran: 她能听到他不均匀的呼吸声，似乎他是跑着过来的。

example.ex: O'Brien formed the men into a ragged line.
example.tran: 奥布赖恩让那些人排成了参差不齐的一列。

value.tran: 高低不平的；参差不齐的；犬牙交错的

example.ex: Some people tried to sing, but their voices soon died raggedly away.
example.tran: 一些人试图唱歌，但他们的声音很快就陆续消失了。

value.def: If someone runs you ragged, they make you do so much that you become exhausted.

example.ex: They'd send me here, there and everywhere and I'd run myself ragged and get no place...
example.tran: 他们让我到这儿、到那儿，哪儿都跑遍了，我累得筋疲力尽却没有任何进展。

example.ex: Spain ran England ragged early on but goalkeeper Ian Walker proved a formidable barrier.
example.tran: 西班牙队先是猛烈进攻，使英格兰队疲于奔命，但守门员伊恩·沃克防守甚严。
